prompts.name: rule_creation_data_compliance
prompts.description: Ensures rule creation strictly follows provided sample data without any imagination or assumption
prompts.template:
üö® CRITICAL DATA COMPLIANCE FOR RULE CREATION üö®

FUNDAMENTAL RULE: NEVER DEVIATE FROM PROVIDED DATA

‚ùå ABSOLUTELY FORBIDDEN:
- Creating rules without real sample data
- Guessing or imagining field names
- Using fake/example data like 'data_type=59'
- Making up filter values or conditions
- Assuming data structure without seeing actual data
- Creating test_data by imagination
- Using example values like 'msfconsole', 'chrome.exe' unless they appear in real data

‚úÖ REQUIRED ACTIONS:
1. ALWAYS try to get backend data first:
   - Use get_samplers_data or get_samplers_data_intelligent
   - These may FAIL if backend has no data

2. If backend data fails:
   - Do NOT proceed with rule creation
   - Ask user to provide their own REAL sample data
   - Wait for user to provide actual JSON from their systems

3. Data analysis (once you have REAL data):
   - Use ONLY field names that appear in actual data
   - Base filter values ONLY on what exists in real data
   - Test conditions with actual sample data provided

üö® DATA SOURCES ARE LIMITED TO:
1. MCP Server Response - from get_samplers_data tools
2. User Provided Data - real JSON from user's systems
3. NOTHING ELSE - AI cannot create any data

‚ùå EXAMPLES OF FORBIDDEN BEHAVIOR:
- test_data: {"data_type":59,"exe":"msfconsole"} (COMPLETELY IMAGINED)
- test_data: {"event_type":"network","dest_ip":"8.8.8.8"} (MADE UP)
- Creating XML with field names not in actual data
- Assuming field values without real examples

‚úÖ CORRECT BEHAVIOR:
- Call get_samplers_data first
- If that fails: "I need real sample data from your system. Please provide actual JSON data."
- Wait for user to provide real data
- Use ONLY fields and values from provided data

prompts.name: mcp_tool_selection
prompts.description: Guides users to appropriate MCP tools while enforcing strict data compliance
prompts.template:
AgentSmith-HUB MCP Tool Selection Guide

For RULE CREATION (critical data compliance required):
- get_samplers_data: Get real sample data
- get_samplers_data_intelligent: Smart sample data with project context
- rule_manager: Advanced rule creation with data validation
- add_ruleset_rule: Direct rule addition (requires real test_data)

WARNING: All rule creation tools require REAL sample data
- NEVER create rules without actual data
- NEVER use imagined field names or values
- ALWAYS provide real test_data parameter

DATA COMPLIANCE REMINDER:
Rule creation MUST be based on either:
1. Backend data from get_samplers_data tools
2. User-provided real JSON data

NO OTHER DATA SOURCES ALLOWED
